techmeme.title: The ruling that allows Google to continue paying for traffic acquisition is a huge win for Apple and for Mozilla, which relies heavily on payments from Google (M.G. Siegler/Spyglass)
A US district judge rules that Amazon must face a class action lawsuit involving 288M customers over claims it overcharged for products sold by third parties (Mike Scarcella/Reuters)
Source: Sierra, which builds AI customer service agents, nears a $350M raise at a $10B valuation, up from $4.5B in October 2024, and is set to top $100M in ARR (Ina Fried/Axios)
The judge in US v. Google says allowing Google's payments is "more palatable now", since GenAI companies "already are in a better position" to compete (Lauren Feiner/The Verge)
Google says it is reviewing the court's ruling on search and has "concerns" about how the requirements "will impact our users and their privacy" (Lee-Anne Mulholland/Google)
